nodes.text:
The badge insert dispenser is bolted to the wall at chest height.
A laminated label above it reads: “VISITOR BADGE INSERTS — TAKE ONE.”
The stack behind the plastic window looks intact in the way abandoned things look: untouched, not maintained.

A smaller sticker has been added later, slightly crooked: “EXPIRED STOCK NOT TO BE DISCARDED.”
Someone underlined “NOT” hard enough to wrinkle the laminate.

choices.text: look Check the desk drawer (old badges).
leave Go to Guard Shack Exterior (down).
leave Go to Admin Lobby and Kiosk (right).

nodes.text:
The main label is corporate-clean.
The expiration notice is handwritten on tape: “KIOSK REJECTS WITHOUT INSERT.”
The handwriting pauses on “rejects,” like it enjoyed writing it.

Below, in smaller print: “Insert validity governed by issuance date.”
That line is printed. The guilt is not.

You press the plastic tab.
The mechanism gives with a soft, reluctant click—like it’s documenting your fingerprints.

One insert shifts forward into the slot, ready to be taken.
The date stamp visible through the window is not recent.

The desk drawer sticks, then opens with a dry pop.
Inside: old visitor badges, bent corners, faded photos, and inserts in plastic sleeves that have all gone cloudy.

A rubber band is wrapped around a small bundle labeled “TEMP — DO NOT SHRED.”
The label is neat. The rubber band is not.

The speaker grille is painted over. The button isn’t.
When you press it, the line opens with a tone that sounds like a form being created.

Guard Shack vestibule line is active.
If this is about the dispenser: yes, it is stocked.
“Expired” is a materials designation, not— I’m not saying ignore it. I’m saying don’t make it an access conversation.

choices.text: ask It’s expired. Will the kiosk accept it?
ask Why is expired stock still here?
persuade [OLEA] I’m closing the site. I need a path that passes audit.

nodes.text:
The kiosk evaluates presence of an insert.
It does not evaluate your feelings about the date.
The date is for issuance governance, which is a separate workflow, owned by a separate— look, I’m not the date.

I did not say “not current.”
I said “presence.”
Currentness implies a schedule. Schedules imply staffing. Staffing implies we’re open.
We are not open.
The line stays open, waiting for you to stop making it one thing by calling it another.

Issuance governance is owned by Admin Services, historically.
Historically is doing work in that sentence.
If you need a name, you can file a request for custodian attribution. It will return “unassigned,” which is technically an answer.

Because disposal creates a record, and records create questions.
Also because the last time someone “cleaned up,” they cleaned up the wrong thing and we had to un-clean it.
So now we do “stabilization,” which is like cleaning, but less actionable.

Okay— okay. “Passes audit” is a phrase that makes everyone behave.
The kiosk checks: insert present, name entered, time stamp generated. That’s it.
The insert date is not validated at the kiosk. It is validated during issuance, which is not happening here, because— and I’m saying this carefully— there is no issuer on-site.

Take one insert. Don’t take a handful. A handful looks like intent.
And if someone later asks why it’s expired, you say: “Stock provided on-site.” That’s a location statement. It’s not a decision statement.
The voice stops, like it just slid a document across a table and doesn’t want to watch you read it.

I can’t advise bypassing issuance governance.
If the dispenser is stocked, it is stocked.
If a workflow rejects, you should submit a workflow exception request through the kiosk help panel— if it’s online.
If it’s not online, then it’s not rejecting anything, is it.

You release the button.
The line closes cleanly, as if it never existed in the first place.

You pull a single visitor badge insert from the dispenser.
It’s expired, laminated, and perfectly usable in the way compliance hates: technically.
The slot behind it advances the next insert forward, ready to pretend this is a normal day.
Visitor badge insert acquired.
You step back from the dispenser and head down toward the Guard Shack Exterior.
You leave the vestibule and move right toward the Admin Lobby and Kiosk.
